headline: Western Digital Sells Sandisk Stake To Cut Debt And Fund AI Storage
summary: Western Digital has launched a multibillion dollar secondary offering of its Sandisk stake. The sale is intended to fully monetize its spin off position in Sandisk and reduce debt. The transaction is framed as part of Western Digital's broader capital allocation and balance sheet plan. Western Digital, trading on NasdaqGS:WDC, is drawing fresh attention as it moves to cash out of Sandisk after spinning the business off. The company is pairing this secondary sale with its ongoing focus on...

headline: This Week In AI Chips - NVIDIA Partnership Signals Growth in AI Infrastructure Investment
summary: Recent developments in the AI chips sector highlight AlphaTON Capital’s strategic move to enhance its AI infrastructure by deploying 504 NVIDIA B200 GPU computers in Canada. Valued at $30 million, this deployment is expected to play a significant role in scaling the company's AI revenues, offering hourly rentals to developers and enterprises. This initiative is set against a backdrop of increasing global demand for privacy-centric AI infrastructure, prompted by tighter regulatory requirements...

headline: Equal Weight Tech Fund Beat QQQ by 216% Through One Simple Rebalancing Method
summary: The SPDR NYSE Technology ETF (NYSEARCA:XNTK) offers something most tech ETFs don’t: equal-weighted exposure to the full technology spectrum. While mega-cap funds like QQQ concentrate 40% of assets in five stocks, XNTK spreads risk across 68.4% technology holdings with its largest position capped at 4.50%. This structure appeals to investors who want broad tech participation ... Equal Weight Tech Fund Beat QQQ by 216% Through One Simple Rebalancing Method

headline: Billionaire David Tepper Goes Big on Micron, Meta, and Alphabet in AI All-In

headline: Top AI Investor Gavin Baker Bets Big on Nvidia With Leveraged Call Options

headline: Micron’s Massive US$200b Bet On AI Memory Demand And Supply Security
summary: Micron Technology is committing around $200b to expand memory chip manufacturing capacity, with major projects in New York, Idaho, and Japan. The company reports that its entire high bandwidth memory output is already allocated through 2026. Customers are entering multi year supply agreements, reflecting a tight AI related memory market and strong demand visibility. Micron Technology (NasdaqGS:MU) is positioned at the center of the current AI hardware build out, with its high bandwidth...
